title: The steady progress of Tommy Paul can't be ignored
description: After three ATP tour titles in 2024 and now in the top 10 for the first time in his career, American Tommy Paul knows he's capable of even more.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Everything to know about the Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek doping cases
description: Last year, Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek each tested positive for a banned substance. Here's where each doping case stands.Ôªø
author: Jake Michaels

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Cerundolo cracks Etcheverry code, reaches Santiago SFs
description: Third time's the charm! Argentine Francisco Cerundolo earned his first Lexus ATP Head2Head win in three attempts against countryman Tomas Martin Etcheverry on Friday at the Movistar Chile Open, where the top seed is into the semi-finals. The 26-year-old rallied from a set down to oust the heavy-hitting Etcheverry 4-6, 6-3, 7-5. ‚ÄúToday was a really tough match,‚Äù said Cerundolo, who struck 31 winners, including 21 behind his forehand. ‚ÄúTomy is an incredible player, incredible fighter, incredible friend. He‚Äôs one of my best friends on Tour. It‚Äôs really difficult to play against him. ‚ÄúI think we both played really nervous today. We played well but I think we both were a little bit tight, nervous. I think we played a really good match and it was really close.‚ÄùIce-cold Francisco! ü•∂@FranCerundolo keeps his nerve in the all-üá¶üá∑ clash, defeating compatriot Etcheverry 4-6 6-3 7-5, to reach his 7‚É£th ATP Tour semi-final! üëè@chile_open | #MovistarChileOpen pic.twitter.com/AC85TzrZ92‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) February 28, 2025 Cerundolo created 14 break chances, converting 11, including a crucial break at 5-5 in the decider, allowing the No. 26 player in the PIF ATP Rankings to serve out the two-hour, 54-minute battle. The fifth seed Etcheverry defeated Cerundolo in Santiago two years ago en route to a final appearance. At last year's US Open, Etcheverry again overcame Cerundolo in five sets. Cerundolo will next face Serbian Laslo Djere, who ousted Jaime Faria 7-6(5), 4-6, 6-4 after two hours and 42 minutes. The 29-year-old saved 11 of the 14 break points he faced, according to Infosys ATP Stats. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: World Tennis Conference 5 casts Gilles Cervara and Toni Nadal among key speakers
description: The World Tennis Conference is back in 2025 for its fifth edition, bringing together a stellar lineup of experts. The four-day event will feature some of the sport‚Äôs most influential coaches, players, and sports scientists. Among the headline speakers are Gilles Cervara, Louis Cayer and Toni Nadal. Supported by the ATP Tour, WTC5 aims to create a bridge of awareness between top coaches, scientists, leaders and experts in the sport. The informative event will be held virtually from 27-30 March. Attendees can look forward to 70 insightful presentations, including many from current ATP Tour coaches, along with eight live panels featuring 24 speakers. Additionally, special workshops will provide in-depth exploration of key topics. Sign up on the official World Tennis Conference 5 website: ‚ÄúDream big, coach better!‚Äù All registered coaches will enjoy unlimited access to each presentation for more than 45 days, allowing them to absorb the knowledge at their own pace. They will also receive the exclusive WTC5 WorkBook, which compiles the Top 10 recommendations from each presenter. Other notable speakers at the event include Liam Smith, Claudio Pistolesi, Alberto Castellani, Emilio Sanchez Vicario, Kristof Vliegen, Rick Macci, Murphy Jensen, Domink Hrbaty, Dr. Jack Groppel, Dr. Jim Loehr, Robert Lindsted, Pepe Vendrell, Ali Ghelem, Dr. Ann Quinn, Dr. Roberto Vavassori, Carlos Kirmayr, Brett Hobden, Gordon Uehling, Diego Moyano, Tom Corrie, Robert Davis, Juan Manuel Esparcia, and many others. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Raducanu to play Indian Wells after stalking ordeal
description: Britain's Emma Raducanu will travel to the WTA tournament in Indian Wells after deciding to play following her recent stalking ordeal.

title: Sinner's Laureus award nomination withdrawn after ban
description: Jannik Sinner's nomination for the Laureus World Sportsman of the Year award is withdrawn after he was given a three-month doping ban.

title: Sinner Dominates in One Sided Australian Open Final
description: Jannik Sinner successfully defended his Australian Open title on Sunday, landing his third Grand Slam commandingly with a 6-3, 7-6(4), 6-3 victory over Alexander Zverev. Sinner was ruthless from the baseline and did not face a single break point throughout the two-hour, 42-minute final. The Italian showed his extra firepower from the outset, which has ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: Australian Open 2025 Day 13 Semi Final Recap
description: Jannik Sinner and Alexander Zverev will face off in Sunday‚Äôs 2025 Australian Open final after winning their semi-finals on Friday. Alexander Zverev was the first to move into Sunday‚Äôs showpiece, defeating Novak Djokovic when the Serb retired after losing the first set on a tiebreak. Novak had not hit a tennis ball since his win ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan
